total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the non-zero elements in the input grid and their positions.
Q2: For each non-zero element, create a square frame around it by replacing the zero elements with the value of the non-zero element.
Q3: Ensure that the square frame does not overlap with other frames. If it does, maintain the value of the first frame.
Q4: The non-zero element should be at the center of the square frame.
Q1: Identify the non-zero elements in the input grid and their positions.
Q2: For each non-zero element, create a square frame with the element's value, where the element's position is the center of the square.
Q3: If the square frame exceeds the grid boundary, adjust it to fit within the grid.
Q4: Fill the outermost layer of the square frame with the element's value, and fill the inner part of the square with 0s.
Q5: Repeat Q2-Q4 for all non-zero elements in the input grid.
Q6: If there are overlapping frames, the frame created later will overwrite the overlapping part of the frame created earlier.

Q5: Fill the inner part of the square frame with 0.
Q6: Repeat steps Q2 to Q5 for all non-zero elements in the input grid.
Q7: If there are overlapping frames, the frame created later will overwrite the overlapping part of the frame created earlier.
